column4: ï»¿Just a refresh... I am dual booting Ubuntu on a macbook pro... chipset is as follows:  AR5418 802.11abgn Wireless PCI Express Adapter (rev 01),  I download and installed a thinkpad driver, and it's showing as valid... but my wireless is not. showing any ideas?  Definitely still looking for help.
how do you get ubuntu to boot on your macbook ??
I just installed but I need the CD in, boot to that and then tell it to boot from first hdd
when you turn on your mac... do you press eomthing ??
yes I installed duovoice... it gives me the option of a linux HDD boot but then I get "no boot device"
do you have the URL that you used to install ubuntu ???
is there something else i need to type with that... it gives me a fatal error
you have two choices; ndiswrapper or madwifi trunk
do you see the card listed? if so, trype modprobe ndiswrapper
yes, the device should now be listed in iwconfig
it should show in the network manager thing
